update.description:
Screen shot of `lights.world`: https://www.dropbox.com/s/33zwdc94bvu7fyw/lights5.png

* Fixed loading point / spot / directional lights (type, target, color...)

* Added `helpers` (light visuals), the green lines representing each light type

* Lights can be selected and manipulated (light's target moves with the light)

* White default lights can be inserted from the insert menu or, for desktop, from the header
update.title: Lights

content.raw:
Actually now it updates all object's materials, because the new light wasn't illuminating all of them.

commit 6ef4b51
content.html:
Actually now it updates all object's materials, because the new light wasn't illuminating all of them.

commit 6ef4b51

update.title: Lights

content.raw:
The thing with `createEntity` is... While for models there is `~/factory` and `~/model/modify`, for lights, both spawning a new one and modifying an existing one use `~/light`. 

So I created this variable in order to differentiate the two light topics on `GazeboInterface.cc`. It is only used by the lights, but ends up in the models too... I'm sure there must be a more elegant way to do it...
content.html:
The thing with createEntity is... While for models there is ~/factory and ~/model/modify, for lights, both spawning a new one and modifying an existing one use ~/light.

So I created this variable in order to differentiate the two light topics on GazeboInterface.cc. It is only used by the lights, but ends up in the models too... I'm sure there must be a more elegant way to do it...
